titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Placebo Houston papers, 1790-1861
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Personal and family correspondence with relatives in Alabama, Mississippi, and Missouri, describing the climate and crops, social life and customs, prices of slaves and land, religion, and daily life. Included are several wills.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Placebo Houston Papers, 1790-1861, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Placebo Houston was a captain of the North Carolina Rangers, from Houstonville (Iredell County), North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Personal and family correspondence with relatives in Alabama, Mississippi, and Missouri, describing the climate and crops, social life and customs, prices of slaves and land, religion, and daily life. Included are several wills.
